intro: Castalia edulis, commonly known as the edible castalia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes plants like taro and calla lilies. The plant features a thick, fleshy rhizome that is the primary edible part, often cooked and consumed as a starchy vegetable. Its leaves are arrow-shaped and can grow quite large, while the flowers are typically small and clustered in an inflorescence. Castalia edulis is valued not only for its nutritional content but also for its role in traditional cuisines.
